bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October 27, 1898

div1.p: Lawrence Reed requests items from home. He expects to be shipped out soon.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October 27, 1898
div1.p:
Dont you know that I had made up my mind to tell
you a lot of little things when I was home, but as you never get near
the subject I really forgot all about them. so I am going to try and
write you a real nice letter and tell you all about my troubles. There
are only four things that I want are only four things that I want, but I sure do want them bad. I would
like one more sheet, as we only have 2 and cant get more. a real pillow
with pillow cases, as ours are mighty hard, my army blankets I had at
school, if you have no use for them. to make“me”bunk“soft and easy like!
and cut off my night shirts making them about the length of an ordinary
shirt. and I will promise to make the best use of them I can.

The transport “Mississippi” came in this morning bringing the 6th. Mass
Vols. home, it is rumored that after she is fixed out again that she
will take us to our new station. I am as well as I ever was in my life
and such a nice little trip as I had home I can work for that com. like
the -- I did not think it was so late when I sat down but I find
that it is dinner time so I will have to stop.
Best love to all and think over the things I asked you about
div1.closer:
Aff. Your Son- Lawrence now a Sergt. Battery “C” 2nd Artillery
Acting Post Sergt.Major
but some day A 2nd Lieut of some Co. and some
regiment.
“And then he woke up” quotation from DeWolf Hopper
